author: Special Correspondent
text:
In detail:S.Narayanan, Assistant Commissioner of Police (Crime), interacting with bank officials at Anna Nagar Police Station in Madurai on Monday.— Photo: S. James

The city police on Monday reviewed security systems of banks and financial institutions in the city with their officials.

Commissioner of Police Shailesh Kumar Yadav ordered the Assistant Commissioners of Police (Crime) in the four sub-divisions to hold meetings with the officials to assess safety aspects of the premises, including strength of doors, windows, and ventilator grilles.

The availability of burglar alarms and their working aspects were also discussed with the officials. Assistant Commissioner of Police (Crime), Anna Nagar, S. Narayanan, said whether the wires of burglar alarms were concealed or vulnerable for easy disconnection by the burglars was also discussed.

He advised the bank officials to go for hi-tech alarms that would send messages about breach of security on the office premises to officials over their mobile phones.

Night watchmen

Availability of closed-circuit television cameras, their position, the night-vision feature in the system and safety of control units and wiring were also reviewed. They then discussed deployment of night watchmen at the banks.

Bank officials asked to go for hi-tech alarms that would send messages about breach of security over their mobile phones
title: Security of banks in city reviewed
